result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D. Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to 22CF272 but consecutive to any others

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample to be provided.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No posession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substances and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  AODA and any recommended follow up treatment/counseling per agent.  Must notify agent w/in 24 hours if a prescription is received.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon D. Hughes

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing, Arraignment, Plea/Sentencing Hearing 9-26-22

1:12 PM Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brandon D. Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  State notes victim notification rights have been met in all cases and there is nothing further to provide.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 22CF339 only.  Atty Duren waives prelim, as does DE.  Court questions DE on waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in 22CF339.  State states the joint rec as to all 3 cases.  Atty Duren is in agreement and acknowledges rec. information in 22CF339 and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges max penalties of that doc and enters NG pleas at this time.  Atty Duren enters NC pleas to Count 1 in each of 22CF272 and 22CF339.  DE also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes statement.  Atty Duren makes statement.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

22CF155 is dismissed/read-in

22CF272
Ct 1:  NC 
Cts 2-6:  Dismissed/read-in

22CF339
Ct 1:  NC 
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

2 years prison (1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision) concurrent to each other but consecutive to any others
DE would be eligible for SAP and CIP
$518.00 in 22CF272 and $528.00 in 22CF339 costs/surcharges
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of extended supervision:
Absolute sobriety at all times
No possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. 
AODA and any recommended follow up treatment/counseling per agent
Must notify agent if prescription rec'd w/in 24 hours

***All remaining counts are dismissed/read-in

10:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brandon D. Hughes.  Court states case and appearances.  Court makes record re: this being moved up to 10:30 this morning instead of 1pm the pm.  Atty Duren requests prelim.  Bond continued.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon D. Hughes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Brandon D. Hughes.  Court states case and appearances.  DE does qualify for PD and Atty Duren will be taking this case.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State requests $10,000 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Hayes responds - requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with D.E.H. or Howie's Repair.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Return date scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
